Ad Text:
Hello. We're Virgin Australia. We're the airline that's always done things a little different. Our way. The Virgin way. We're on a mission to make flying better than 'nice'. And to do that, it takes a team of talented people who are passionate about customer experience, doing the right thing always, with a focus on safety -- in the air, on the ground and in our workplaces. A team who values real diversity and inclusion, in a big brand with big ambitions.

What you'll be doing:

This Senior Associate, Strategy & Planning position is a newly created role to support our new, Integrated Planning team that is part of our Strategy & Transformation division. You will play a pivotal role in supporting Virgin Australia's Integrated Planning transformation by analysing strategic planning scenarios, operational and schedule planning processes, uncovering efficiency opportunities, and developing strategic insights. You'll work independently on strategic planning analyses across multiple time horizons, from seasonal schedule planning to long-term strategic questions.

Leveraging your analytical expertise and technical skills, you'll create data-driven insights that support Virgin Australia's transition to new planning cycles, moving beyond traditional network design to focus on operational execution excellence. This role offers a unique opportunity to make a significant impact on our company's success as we continue our exciting growth journey!

Further responsibilities:

This role requires sharp analytical skills, structured problem-solving capabilities, and the ability to understand complex operational systems
You'll translate operational, commercial, and competitor data into strategic insights and evaluate planning trade-offs
Communicate recommendations clearly to stakeholders from front-line operations to executive leadership
Your work will directly inform strategic planning decisions that improve our on-time performance, reduce costs, support sustainable growth, and shape our long-term strategic direction
Conduct advanced financial and operational modelling for planning initiatives
Collaborate with cross-divisional teams on analytics projects to advance integrated planning capabilities
Structure ambiguous operational or strategic problems, to create a hypothesis and then work independently to find a favourable solution to recommend to the business

You'll be great in this role if you have

A degree in Commerce, Economics, Mathematics, Engineering, or a related field
3–4 years’ experience in management consulting (MBB preferred), investment banking, corporate strategy, or operational improvement
Experience structuring ambiguous operational or strategic problems and driving to solutions independently (structured problem-solving and hypothesis-driven thinking)
Exceptional analytical and problem-solving skills. You can navigate ambiguity, work across large datasets, and distil complexity into clarity
Advanced Excel modelling and data analysis skills
Strong communication and storytelling ability, with experience developing executive-level presentations that drive decisions
A proactive, self-starter mindset with the ability to juggle multiple priorities in a fast-paced environment

What you'll get from us

We're committed to looking after you, with some of the best benefits and conditions in the industry -- including (but not limited to):

Discounted flights for you and your loved ones (plus $1000 travel credits per year)
Flexible and hybrid working, with a mix of working from home and the office
'Dress for Your Day' -- wear whatever makes you feel great for the type of work you do and the day you have ahead of you
One of Brisbane's most admired office locations, with South Bank train station, a supermarket, pharmacy, lunch options, the Busway nearby, a rooftop restaurant, onsite gym and South Bank across the road
Discounts on travel insurance, lounge membership, car hire, accommodation, and experiences worldwide
Cheaper hospitality, retail, technology, beauty and wellness services
Free counselling and online tools to support your physical, mental, social and financial health

When everyone is included, everyone wins

We're all individuals. And we love that. That's why we encourage applications from Indigenous Australians, people with disability, those from diverse cultural backgrounds, our friends in the LGBTIQ+ community, and anyone else who wants to join us.

Ready to apply?

Working at Virgin Australia isn't just a job. It's a passion that becomes part of you. Are you ready to join us? Get ready for a rewarding experience. Apply today!

Company: Australian Institute of Health and Welfare
Ad Text:
The Australian Institute of Health and Welfare (AIHW) is Australia’s authoritative source of health and welfare data and analysis. As an independent national information and statistics agency within the Commonwealth’s Health portfolio, the AIHW publishes more than 400 data products each year, maintains and administers specialised national data standards and classifications, and supports high quality research.

AIHW are seeking to fill two roles:

- Group Head – Population Health Group SES Band 1; and

- Group Head – Housing and Specialised Services Group, SES Band 1.

The AIHW has recently established 3 divisions - the Health Insights Division, Community and First Nations Insights Division and the Corporate Strategy and Performance Division. Currently, Group Head vacancies exist in the Health Insights Division (for the Population Health Group), and the Community and First Nations Insights Division (for the Housing and Specialised Services Group). Both these roles report to Executive Directors (SES Band 2) and form part of the institute’s senior leadership team.

The Population Health Group comprises several units covering burden of disease, cancer, chronic conditions, preventive health and injuries. The group collects, compiles, analyses and presents comprehensive data about the health of Australians. The group has a particular role to play in expanding the amount of evidence available, particularly in relation to cancer and linkage across domains such as aged care and disability.

The Housing and Specialised Services Group comprises several units that collect and analyse data to support reporting and policy decisions on the health and welfare of Australians. The Group has a particular focus on specialised services including housing, veterans supports, drug and alcohol supports, child protection systems, youth justice systems and correctional facilities.  

To be a strong contender for either of these important roles you will have experience leading data management, analytical, reporting and/or statistical functions and have a strong working understanding of the Australian health and welfare landscape. You will excel in working in complex environments and you will be forward thinking, innovative and adept at building relationships across a broad range of sectors. Your integrity, judgement and strong leadership credentials will be paramount. Your impressive personal style and ability to engender trust and respect will be complemented by intellectual rigor, critical analysis, and first class communication and presentation skills.

For further information on the eligibility requirements, selection criteria and how to apply please visit the AIHW careers page and download the position description. If, after reading the selection documentation, you require further information please contact Tricia Searson or Karina Duffey at Executive Intelligence Group on (02) 6232 2200. 

Applications close: 11.30pm AEDT 30 November 2025.
